summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorneys discussing the filing of a Daubert motion in the Epstein case. The emails focus on procedural details such as redacting exhibits, filing under seal, and coordinating proofreading and cite-checking.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge who would need to approve filing an exhibit under seal in the Daubert motion proceedings.

persons.name: Rocchio
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of witness preparation ('Rocchio witness prep') that one of the attorneys is joining.

events.title: Daubert Motion Preparation
events.description: Assistant United States Attorneys coordinate the finalization and filing of a Daubert motion, discussing redactions, sealing exhibits, and proofreading.

locations.name: Southern District of New York
locations.context: Jurisdiction where the attorneys are based and where the legal proceedings are taking place.

locations.name: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
locations.context: Address of the Assistant United States Attorney's office in the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The document shows ongoing legal proceedings in the Epstein case as of November 2021, specifically involving a Daubert motion.
Prosecutors are coordinating to file exhibits under seal, indicating sensitive material is involved.
The email chain reveals internal prosecution team workflow including proofreading, cite-checking, and witness preparation.
The correspondence is between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York.
